intro: Acisanthera limnobios, commonly known as the water lily of the marshes, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Nychthemeralaceae. It is characterized by its floating leaves and showy, fragrant flowers that bloom at night. The plant thrives in shallow freshwater habitats such as ponds and wetlands. Its roots are anchored in the mud, while its leaves form a floating canopy on the water surface. The flowers typically have four petals and are pollinated by nocturnal insects.
